intro: Stachys nutans, commonly known as hanging vetch or blueweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers that hang in clusters, giving it its common name. Stachys nutans typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
